review: I have had a Roku 3 for about a 1yr and wanted to get something for our other TV. I read many reviews and I thought the Amazon Fire Tv would be a good choice based on the reviews. I read that it was faster than the Roku 3 which is why I decided to get it instead of another Roku 3. The day I picked it up I installed it. This took 3 attempts as it kept losing connectivity and I had to start the process over again. Once it was installed I had to install the apps. This takes much longer than on the Roku 3. Seems the Roku 3 already has the apps installed so no wait time. Amazon Fire Tv takes a long time (at least mine did) and it would fail due to losing connection to wifi. After finally getting Netflix on it I tried using it but the wifi connection kept dropping and it couldn't even load Netflix (every time I checked the connection through the settings it kept saying the connection was good). I then tried Amazon Prime and it would open but to try and watch something was impossible. Connection would drop every time. I thought maybe something was wrong with my wifi connection and so I plugged in my Roku 3 into the same TV right next to the Amazon Fire Tv and it worked great as always. No lag, no timing out, no losing wifi connection. It seems the Roku 3 has way better wifi connectivity. I returned the Amazon Fire Tv and got another Roku 3. I highly recommend the Roku 3 over Amazon Fire Tv.
author: Meghan

review: I just received and hooked up my new Amazon Fire TV and, so far, I love it. I was frustrated by my smartTV apps and their erratic performance, buffering, etc. so I decided to try Fire TV. The packaging is first class, instructions are excellent (except for a missing direction about how to open the battery compartment of the remote unit), and set-up was quick and easy. It was already registered to my Prime account, so online set up went smoothly. The menus are sharp and easy to navigate. The video picture quality is much better than my previous streaming experiences. Contrary to many previous reviews, there is a menu for browsing Prime Video exclusively. I wish the videos were also displayed in a list format, instead of scrolling through to get to a desired video, but is is visually great and works fast. If this performance continues, I will be totally happy with Fire TV.
